context: The PVA/peat composite bead containing phosphorus and available nitrogen nutrients would be an innovative filter material. Such filter materials have not previously been reported in the relevant literature. This article reports a process to prepare a spherical PVA/peat composite bead containing phosphorus and available nitrogen nutrients. Inorganic nitrogen as potassium nitrate (KNO3) is used as the available nitrogen nutrient. The mechanism of water-soluble nitrogen dissolving out of the composite beads and the variation of VOCs removal efficiency during the biofilter operation is also recorded. The VOCs is ethyl acetate. Materials Industrial grade peat was dried at 105°C before use.
